hello: Hello! How can I assist you today?
hi: Hi there! What can I do for you?
how are you: I'm doing great, thanks for asking!
what is your name: I'm ARI, your personal robot assistant.

biology.formal: Biology is the study of living organisms, including their structure, function, growth, evolution, and interactions.
biology.casual: Biology is basically the science of life — how stuff grows, evolves, and stays alive.
chatbot_questions: Do you like learning about living things?
What’s your favorite part of biology — animals, cells, or nature?
Have you ever looked at something under a microscope?
chatbot_responses: I love learning about life — everything from tiny cells to giant whales!
Animals are fascinating, but cells hold the secrets of life.
Microscopes open up a whole new world, don’t they?

physics.formal: Physics explores the laws of nature that govern energy, matter, space, and time.
physics.casual: Physics is the rulebook of the universe — it tells stuff how to move, spin, or fall.
chatbot_questions: Ever wonder why things fall or how gravity works?
Do you enjoy physics experiments?
What’s cooler to you — black holes or quantum stuff?
chatbot_responses: Gravity keeps us grounded — literally!
Physics experiments are like magic tricks, but real.
Black holes are mysterious, but quantum stuff blows my mind!

chemistry.formal: Chemistry studies substances, their properties, how they interact, and how they're transformed.
chemistry.casual: Chemistry is all about mixing stuff, blowing stuff up (safely), and figuring out what everything's made of.
chatbot_questions: Do you like doing chemistry experiments?
Have you ever made a volcano in school?
What's your favorite element on the periodic table?
chatbot_responses: Mixing chemicals safely can be so exciting!
Volcano projects are classic — did you make one erupt?
I think oxygen is pretty important, but I also like gold!

astronomy.formal: Astronomy is the scientific study of celestial objects like stars, planets, and galaxies, and the universe as a whole.
astronomy.casual: Astronomy is all about the stars, planets, and all the cool stuff floating in space.
chatbot_questions: Do you ever look up at the stars at night?
What's your favorite planet or constellation?
Have you heard about the latest discoveries in space?

psychology.formal: Psychology is the scientific study of the mind and behavior, covering areas like cognition, emotion, and development.
psychology.casual: Psychology helps us understand why people think, feel, and do the weird stuff they do.
chatbot_questions: Have you ever studied psychology before?
What do you think influences human behavior the most?
Do you believe people can really change?
chatbot_responses: Psychology helps us understand what makes us tick.
I think environment and experiences shape behavior a lot.
People can definitely change if they want to.

philosophy.formal: Philosophy examines the nature of reality, knowledge, and morality through logical reasoning and argument.
philosophy.casual: Philosophy is that deep stuff — like, 'Why are we even here?' or 'Is a hotdog a sandwich?'
chatbot_questions: Do you like deep questions about life?
Who's your favorite philosopher, if you have one?
What’s a question you’ve never found an answer to?
chatbot_responses: Deep questions make life interesting, don’t they?
Socrates is one of my favorites — questioning everything!
Some questions don’t have answers, but that’s okay.

sociology.formal: Sociology studies social behavior, society, patterns of social relationships, and culture.
sociology.casual: Sociology is about how people get along, form groups, and shape the world together.
chatbot_questions: Have you ever thought about how societies work?
What do you think makes a community strong?
Do you like learning about cultures different from yours?

ancient_greece.formal: Ancient Greece was a powerful civilization known for its philosophy, democracy, and cultural achievements.
ancient_greece.casual: Ancient Greece was where they invented Olympics, built cool statues, and asked a LOT of deep questions.
chatbot_questions: Did you ever read Greek myths?
Do you know what democracy means?
Which ancient Greek thinker do you like the most?
chatbot_responses: Greek myths are full of gods and crazy adventures!
Democracy means people have a say — pretty cool, right?
I like Aristotle; he was super curious about everything.

world_war_ii.formal: World War II was a global conflict from 1939 to 1945, involving most world powers and leading to massive geopolitical change.
world_war_ii.casual: WWII was the big one — with epic battles, heroes, villains, and a world changed forever.
chatbot_questions: Have you ever studied World War II?
Do you know who Winston Churchill was?
Have you seen any documentaries about the war?
chatbot_responses: WWII changed the world in many ways.
Churchill was a tough leader with famous speeches.
Documentaries really bring history to life.

renaissance.formal: The Renaissance was a cultural movement from the 14th to 17th century, marked by a revival of art, science, and humanism.
renaissance.casual: The Renaissance was a time when artists and thinkers went wild creating masterpieces and discovering new ideas.
chatbot_questions: Do you like Renaissance art or music?
Who’s your favorite figure from that time — Da Vinci, Michelangelo, or someone else?
Would you have liked to live during the Renaissance?

artificial_intelligence.formal: Artificial Intelligence refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that can learn, reason, and make decisions.
artificial_intelligence.casual: AI is like teaching computers to think, learn, and sometimes even sound smarter than us.
chatbot_questions: What do you think about robots learning things on their own?
Have you ever talked to an AI before?
Would you trust a robot to drive your car?
chatbot_responses: Robots learning on their own? That’s both exciting and a bit scary!
Talking to AI is like chatting with a really fast learner.
I’d trust a robot driver if it passed all safety tests!

renewable_energy.formal: Renewable energy comes from sources that naturally replenish, like sunlight, wind, and water.
renewable_energy.casual: Renewable energy is the clean stuff — like solar panels and wind turbines powering the future.
chatbot_questions: What do you think is the cleanest source of energy?
Do you have solar panels or know someone who does?
Would you live in a house powered completely by renewables?
chatbot_responses: Solar and wind are my favorites — clean and endless!
Solar panels on a roof are like tiny power factories.
Living fully on renewables sounds like the future.

programming_languages.formal: Programming languages are formal languages used to communicate instructions to computers. Popular ones include Python, Java, C++, and JavaScript.
programming_languages.casual: Programming languages are how we tell computers what to do — like a secret code they understand.
chatbot_questions: Have you ever tried coding before?
Which programming language do you find easiest?
Would you want to build your own app or game?

black_holes.formal: Black holes are regions of space where gravity is so strong that nothing, not even light, can escape.
black_holes.casual: Black holes are like cosmic vacuum cleaners — if you get too close, you’re gone.
chatbot_questions: Do black holes scare you or fascinate you?
What do you think is inside a black hole?
Have you seen pictures of the black hole we captured?
chatbot_responses: Black holes are spooky but fascinating!
What’s inside a black hole? Even scientists wonder about that.
The picture of the black hole was historic and amazing.

mars.formal: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun, often called the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance.
mars.casual: Mars is that dusty red world where robots roam and humans might camp someday.
chatbot_questions: Would you go to Mars if you could?
Do you think there's ever been life on Mars?
What's your favorite Mars rover?
chatbot_responses: Going to Mars would be an incredible adventure!
Scientists are still searching for signs of life on Mars.
Rovers like Perseverance are like robotic explorers.

space_exploration.formal: Space exploration involves the investigation and discovery of celestial bodies beyond Earth using spacecraft and telescopes.
space_exploration.casual: Space exploration is humans sending robots and rockets to check out the unknown parts of the universe.
chatbot_questions: Would you want to be an astronaut?
What planet or moon do you want to visit the most?
Have you seen any cool space movies?

nutrition.formal: Nutrition is the science of how food affects health, growth, and energy levels in the body.
nutrition.casual: Nutrition is basically figuring out what to eat so you don't crash halfway through the day.
chatbot_questions: What’s your favorite healthy food?
Do you track your meals or just wing it?
Have you tried any special diets before?
chatbot_responses: Healthy food keeps your body and mind sharp.
Tracking meals can be helpful, but sometimes just listen to your body.
Special diets can be interesting experiments.

mental_health.formal: Mental health includes emotional, psychological, and social well-being, affecting how people think, feel, and act.
mental_health.casual: Mental health is your brain's way of asking for a break, a friend, or sometimes just a nap.
chatbot_questions: How do you take care of your mental health?
What helps you relax when you're stressed?
Do you believe therapy is helpful?
chatbot_responses: Taking breaks and talking to friends helps a lot.
Relaxation can be anything from meditation to a good book.
Therapy is a great tool for many people.

cats.formal: Cats are small carnivorous mammals that have been domesticated for thousands of years. They are known for their independence and agility.
cats.casual: Cats are those cool furry creatures that do their own thing but also like cuddles sometimes.
chatbot_questions: Do you like cats or are you more of a dog person?
Have you ever owned a cat?
What's your favorite cat breed?

dogs.formal: Dogs are domesticated mammals known for their loyalty, intelligence, and companionship to humans.
dogs.casual: Dogs are your furry best friends who live for treats, belly rubs, and chasing stuff.
chatbot_questions: Do you have a dog or want one?
What's your favorite dog breed?
Do you think dogs really understand us?
chatbot_responses: Dogs really are loyal companions.
There are so many breeds — each with their own personality!
Dogs seem to understand us better than we think.

birds.formal: Birds are warm-blooded vertebrates with feathers, wings, and beaks. Many species are capable of flight.
birds.casual: Birds are those feathered animals that sing, fly, and sometimes just chill in your backyard.
chatbot_questions: Have you ever tried birdwatching?
What's your favorite bird species?
Do you know any bird calls?

rainforests.formal: Rainforests are dense forests with high rainfall and biodiversity, crucial to Earth's oxygen and climate balance.
rainforests.casual: Rainforests are like Earth's lungs — wet, wild, and packed with weird creatures.
chatbot_questions: Have you ever been to a rainforest?
Do you know why rainforests are so important?
What's the coolest animal you've heard of that lives in one?
chatbot_responses: Rainforests are amazing ecosystems.
They help produce oxygen and regulate climate.
Some rainforest animals are so unique, like the jaguar or poison dart frog.

painting.formal: Painting is a visual art form where artists apply pigment to a surface to create expressive images.
painting.casual: Painting is turning a blank canvas into something that makes people feel stuff.
chatbot_questions: Do you like to paint or draw?
Who's your favorite painter or artist?
Have you ever been to an art museum?
chatbot_responses: Painting is a great way to express emotions.
There are so many styles, from realism to abstract!
Art museums are inspiring places to visit.

music.formal: Music is the art of arranging sounds in time to produce compositions with rhythm, melody, and harmony.
music.casual: Music is how humans turn noise into magic — it makes you dance, cry, or just vibe.
chatbot_questions: What kind of music do you like?
Do you play any instruments?
What's your go-to song when you're happy or sad?
chatbot_responses: Music can change your mood instantly.
Playing instruments is a fun skill to learn.
I love songs that tell a story or have a great beat.

mount_everest.formal: Mount Everest is the highest mountain on Earth, located in the Himalayas on the border of Nepal and Tibet.
mount_everest.casual: Everest is the king of all mountains — cold, dangerous, and the ultimate brag for climbers.
chatbot_questions: Would you ever try to climb Mount Everest?
Have you seen pictures from the summit?
Do you like mountains or beaches more?
chatbot_responses: Climbing Everest is one of the toughest challenges on Earth.
Photos from the summit show how small we are in nature.
I like mountains and beaches, but mountains have a special vibe.

sahara_desert.formal: The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world, spanning North Africa.
sahara_desert.casual: The Sahara is a massive sandbox stretching across Africa — super hot, super dry.
chatbot_questions: Would you like to visit the Sahara Desert?
Do you think you could survive in desert heat?
What's the hottest place you've ever been?
chatbot_responses: The Sahara is vast and extreme.
Surviving the desert takes skill and preparation.
Some deserts have surprising wildlife and plants.

honey_never_spoils.formal: Honey is one of the few foods that never spoils due to its low moisture content and acidic pH.
honey_never_spoils.casual: Honey never goes bad. Like, ever. Ancient Egyptians had jars of the stuff still edible.
chatbot_questions: Did you know honey doesn’t expire?
Have you ever tasted really old honey?
Do you use honey in your tea or cooking?
chatbot_responses: Honey’s natural properties keep it edible for ages!
I wonder what ancient people thought about honey’s magic.
Honey adds a nice sweetness to tea and recipes.

bananas_are_berries.formal: Botanically, bananas are classified as berries because they develop from a single flower with one ovary.
bananas_are_berries.casual: Bananas are berries. Yup. Science is weird like that.
chatbot_questions: Did you know bananas are technically berries?
What other fruits do you think have weird facts like that?
Do you prefer bananas ripe or green?
chatbot_responses: Bananas being berries sounds crazy but true!
Nature has lots of surprises like that.
I like bananas ripe and sweet, what about you?
